data.title: My Chemical Romance Research Paper - 863 Words
data.text:
My Chemical Romance began as a band shortly after the attacks on the World Trade center on September 9, 2001. Gerard Way, the lead singer, realized that life was too short to wait, and immediately began forming My Chemical Romance with the band’s original drummer, Matt Pelissier. Soon after, Gerard recruited Ray Toro to play the guitar and his younger brother, Mikey Way, to play bass. Mikey Way was actually the person to come up with the band’s infamous name after being inspired by seeing the book: “Three Tales of Chemical Romance” by Irvine Welsh in a Barnes and Noble. With almost all their core members set, My Chemical Romance began recording demos in their drummers attic and proceeded to earn a deal with Eyeball Records, who would later produce the band’s first album. Due to the split of Pencey Prep, Frank Iero, already a friend and giant supporter of the band, joined My Chemical Romance just months before the release of the band’s first album. I Brought You My Bullets, You Brought me Your Love was promoted through online sites such as Myspace, were offered as free downloads, and performing the album in small venues. The success of My Chemical Romance’s first album gained them a large underground following but would have a long …show more content…

The album, although mostly about loss and the reality of losing someone, did extremely well, launching the band into the mainstream. The success of the first album allowed the band to have a 12-year run and gain a huge cult following. My Chemical Romance’s music inspired many who enjoyed the band and created the beginning of the a subculture that would later be referred to as “emo”. Fans of band were usually open-minded and supported of not only other fans but everyone else. My Chemical Romance was aware of how young their fanbase was and although they talked about some dark topics they always made sure to show the positive
